page.title: 13POLICE AND FIRE SUTTON C'FLD
page.content: The{Police and Fire Stations}stand side by side on the Lichfield Road. The{Police}Station was built in 1960 and contains an enquiry desk,interview and charge rooms for the public and social and locker rooms for Police.The team of 83 uniformed and 15 C.I.D. officers is led by a superintendent. Next door is the{Fire}Station,built three years later.There are 28 firemen who work on one of four daily shifts. Only one fire engine is based there. On average they have two{emergency } calls a day but they have never had a single day without some kind of incident.They rescue pets from danger as well as people from fires. The worst fire dealt with was when a Nursing Home burnt down.A fireman was {killed}on duty in 1982.Unfortunately they get a lot of{hoax}calls.
